document.masterDocTitle: Phytoseiid Mites (Acari: Mesostigmata) Of Tunisian Citrus Orchards: Catalogue, Biogeography And Key For Identification

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Phytoseiid Mites (Acari: Mesostigmata) Of Tunisian Citrus Orchards: Catalogue, Biogeography And Key For Identification

treatmentCitation.author: Faraji, F. & Bakker F. & Roig J.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution — This species was recently described in Spain (Baldomar) in V. vinifera . Nothing is known on its biology.

Specimens examined — Takelsa (Cap Bon): April, May, June – 32♀ and 2♂
on
Cupressus sp.
, August – 1♀
on
Tamarix sp.
, May – 2♀
on
Citrus sp.
; Nianou (Cap Bon): May – 1♀ and 2♂
on
Cupressus sp.
; Alia ( Bizerte ): June, July and August – 11♀ and 1♂
on
Cupressus sp.
; Morneg (Tunis): August – 1♀
on
Cupressus sp.
This is the first record of this species in Tunisia
.

23.
Typhlodromus (Typhlodromus) exhilaratus
Ragusa

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Typhlodromus exhilaratus Ragusa 1977: 380
.
Typhlodromus exhilaratus exhilaratus (Ragusa) Chant and Yoshida-Shaul 1987: 1795
.
Typhlodromus exhilaratus americanus (Ragusa) Chant and Yoshida-Shaul 1987: 1795
.
Typhlodromus ( Typhlodromus ) exhilaratus (Ragusa) Mores et al. 2004: 371
;
Chant and McMurtry 2007: 157
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Typhlodromus exhilaratus
has been considered as a synonym of
T. tiliae Oudemans
by
Denmark (1992)
.
Distribution — Cyprus , France , Greece , Israel , Italy , Morocco and USA .

Previous records from Tunisia — Sousse (Sahel region): July 2000 on
M. domestica
; (Cap Bon region): May 2006 on
Citrus sp.
(maltaise, Thomson and lemon); Gafsa (South): March 2007 on
O. Europea
.

Additional records from Tunisia — Takelsa (Cap Bon): July – 5♀ on
Malva sp
.

Biology —
Typhlodromus exhilaratus
was reported as type III predators (generalist predators, able to develop without prey) ( McMurtry and Croft, 1997 ), its food range includes Tetranychidae , Eriophyidae and pollen ( Ragusa, 1979 , 1981 ). Its intrinsic population growth rate ( rm ) is higher on
Eotetranychus carpini (Oudemans)
and pollen than on
P. ulmi
( Castagnoli and Liguori, 1986 ;
Castagnoli et al. , 1989
).

24.
Typhlodromus (Typhlodromus) phialatus Athias-Henriot

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Typhlodromus phialatus Athias-Henriot 1960b: 100
.
Typhlodromus ( Typhlodromus ) phialatus
Athias- Henriot;
Moraes et al. 2004: 366
; Chant and Mc- Murtry 2007: 157.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution — Algeria , Cyprus France , Germany , Hungary , Israel , Italy , Jordan , Moldova , Morocco , Norway , Russia , Spain and Ukraine .

Previous Records from Tunisia — Cap Bon region: June 1994 on
Citrus sp.
,
July 1995
in several vineyards, on V. vinifera ; September 2006 on
Citrus sp.
; Monastir (Sahel region): November 1994 on
Citrus sp.
; Slimane (Cap Bon region) and Sousse (Sahel region): July 2000 on
M. domestica
.

Additional records from Tunisia — Takelsa ( Cap Bon ): December , May , June , July – 7♀
on
Citrus sp.
; July , August – 5♀ and 1♂
on

; July , August – 4♀

on

INAT (Tunis): June – 3♀ on
Citrus sp
.

Biology — This species is known to feed on red spider mites and to consume pollen (
Ferragut et al. , 1987
, 1992).

25.
Typhlodromus (Typhlodromus) setubali Dosse
Distribution — Germany , Israel , Jordan , Morocco and Spain .

Specimens examined — INAT (Tunis): June – 2♀
on
Citrus sp.
This is the first record of this species in Tunisia
.

26.
Typhlodromus (Typhlodromus) ernesti Raguza and Swirski

bibRefCitation.author: Karg W.
bibRefCitation.refString: Karg W. 1989 - Zur Kenntnis der Raubmilben der Typhlodromus pyri Gruppe (Acarina, Phytoseiidae) - Dtsch. Entomol. Z., 36: 273 - 282.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution — Israel , Norway , Russia and Sweden .

Specimens examined — Sidi ThabŁt:
June 2011
– 1♀
on
Citrus sp.
(traps). This is the first record of this species in Tunisia
.
